channel.title: Analytical Methods for Drinking Water
channel.description: Updated Analytical Methods for Drinking Water content from the US Environmental Protection Agency

item.title: Technical Advisory - Laboratory Analysis of Drinking Water Samples for Perfluorooctanoic Acid (PFOA) Using EPA Method 537 Rev. 1.1
item.description:
The technical advisory describes how laboratories should quantitate PFOA using Method 537 to account for linear and branched isomers.

  • Technical Advisory for PFOA using EPA Method 537 Rev. 1.1 (PDF)(4 pp, 123 K, September 2016, 815-B-16-021)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Method 546: Determination of Total Microcystins and Nodularins in Drinking Water and Ambient Water by Adda Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay
item.description:
Method 546 is a procedure for the determination of "total" microcystins (MC) and nodularins (NOD) in finished drinking water and in ambient water using enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA).

  • EPA Method 546 (PDF)(24 pp, 431 K, September 2016, 815-B-16-011)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Method 542: Determination of Pharmaceuticals and Personal Care Products in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry
item.description:
Method 542 is a liquid chromatography, electrospray ionization, tandem mass spectrometry (LC/ESI-MS/MS) method for the determination of pharmaceuticals and personal care products (PPCP) in finished drink­ing water.

  • EPA Method 542 (PDF)(39 pp, 450 K, September 2016, 815-R-15-012)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Most Recent Fact Sheet on Federal Register Action: Expedited Approval of Alternative Test Procedures for Analysis of Contaminants Under Safe Drinking Water Act
item.description:
This fact sheet provides background information, a summary of the action and a table of ASTM methods and vendor-developed methods.

  • Fact Sheet on Federal Register Action: Expedited Approval of Alternative Test Procedures for the Analysis of Contaminants Under the Safe Drinking Water Act; Analysis and Sampling Procedures (PDF)(3 pp, 36 K, July 2016, 815-F-16-005)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Lowest Concentration Minimum Reporting Level (LCMRL) Calculator
item.description:
The Lowest Concentration Minimum Reporting Level (LCMRL) is a laboratory and analyte specific quantity.

The LCMRL:
  • Considers both accuracy and precision in analytical measurement.
  • Is based on linear regression of multiple concentration replicate data and a 99% prediction interval around the regression line.
  • Is used primarily during analytical method development, although laboratories may determine LCMRLs as an aid in determining their single-laboratory minimum quantitation level.

Technical Basis for the Lowest Concentration Minimum Reporting Level (LCMRL) Calculator (PDF)(30 pp, 230 K, About PDF)

Lowest Concentration Minimum Reporting Level (LCMRL) Calculator Application (ZIP)(1 pg, 12 MB, December 2010)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Analytical Methods Developed by EPA for Analysis of Unregulated Contaminants
item.description:
Unregulated Contaminants

The following analytical methods were developed by EPA for analysis of unregulated contaminants (that is in support of the Unregulated Contaminant Monitoring Rule).

You will need Adobe Reader to view some of the files on this page. See EPA’s About PDF page to learn more.

EPA Method Number Method Title
218.7 Determination of Hexavalent Chromium in Drinking Water by Ion Chromatography with Post-Colum Derivatization and UV-Visible Spectroscopic Detection (PDF)
314.0 Determination of Perchlorate in Drinking Water by Ion Chromatography (PDF)
314.1, Rev. 1.0 Determination of Perchlorate in Drinking Water Using Inline Column Concentration/Matrix Elimination Ion Chromatography with Suppressed Conductivity Detection (PDF)
314.2 Determination of Perchlorate in Drinking Water Using Two-Dimensional Ion Chromatography with Suppressed Conductivity Detection (PDF)
331.0, Rev. 1.0 Determination of Perchlorate in Drinking Water by Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry (PDF)
332.0 Determination of Perchlorate in Drinking Water by Ion Chromatography with Suppressed Conductivity and Electrospray Ionization Mass Spectrometry (PDF)
521 Determination of Nitrosamines in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Capillary Column Gas Chromatography with Large Volume Injection and Chemical Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry (MS/MS) (PDF)
522 Determination of 1,4-Dioxane in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction (SPE) and Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS) with Selected Ion Monitoring (SIM) (PDF)
526 Determination of Selected Semivolatile Organic Compounds in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Capillary Column Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS) (PDF)
527 Determination of Selected Pesticides and Flame Retardants in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Capillary Column Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS) (PDF)
528 Determination of Phenols in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Capillary Column Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS)
529 Determination of Explosives and Related Compounds in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Capillary Column Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS) (PDF)
530 Determination of Select Semivolatile Organic Chemicals in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry (GC/MS) (PDF)
532 Determination of Phenylurea Compounds in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and High Performance Liquid Chromatography with UV Detection (PDF)
535, Rev. 1.1 Measurement of Chloroacetanilide and Other Acetamide Herbicide Degradates in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography/Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) (PDF)
537, Rev. 1.1

Determination of Selected Perfluorinated Alkyl Acids in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography/Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) (PDF)

  • Technical Advisory for Perfluorooctanoic Acid (PFOA) using EPA Method 537 Rev. 1.1
538 Determination of Selected Organic Chemicals in Drinking Water by Direct Aqueous Injection-Liquid Chromatography/Tandem Mass Spectrometry (DAI-LC/MS/MS) (PDF)
539 Determination of Hormones in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction (SPE) and Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC-ESI-MS/MS) (PDF)
540 Determination of Selected Organic Chemicals in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography/Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) (PDF)
541 Determination of 1-Butanol, 1,4-Dioxane, 2-Methoxyethanol and 2-Propen-1-ol in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry
542 Determination of Pharmaceuticals and Personal Care Products in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/ESI-MS/MS)
544 Determination of Microcystins and Nodularin in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Liquid Chromatography/Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/MS/MS) (PDF)
545 Determination of Cylindrospermopsin and Anatoxin-a in Drinking Water by Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/ESI-MS/MS)
546 Determination of Total Microcystins and Nodularins in Drinking Water and Ambient Water by Adda Enzyme-Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Method 545 Determination of Cylindrospermopsin and Anatoxin-a in Drinking Water by Liquid Chromatography Electrospray Ionization Tandem Mass Spectrometry (LC/ESI-MS/MS)
item.description:
Method 545 is a LC/ESI-MS/MS method for the determination of the algal toxins, cylindrospermopsin and anatoxin-a, in finished drinking water.

  • EPA Method 545 (PDF)(34 pp, 414 K, April 2015, 815-R-15-009)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Method 541 Determination of 1-Butanol, 1,4-Dioxane, 2-Methoxyethanol and 2-Propen-1-ol in Drinking Water by Solid Phase Extraction and Gas Chromatography/Mass Spectrometry
item.description:
Method 541 is a gas chromatography (GC) method for the determination of 1-butanol, 1,4-dioxane, 2-methoxyethanol, and 2-propen-1-ol in finished drinking water.

  • EPA Method 541 (PDF)(49 pp, 3 MB, November 2015, 815-R-15-011)
item.dc:creator: twells03

item.title: Method 549.2 Determination of Diquat and Paraquat in Drinking Water by Liquid-Solid Extraction
item.description:
Method 549.2 Determination of Diquat and Paraquat in Drinking Water by Liquid-Solid Extraction and High Performance Liquid Chromatography With Ultraviolet Detection

  • Method 549.2 Determination of Diquat and Paraquat in Drinking Water by Liquid-Solid Extraction (PDF)(21 pp, 478 K)
item.dc:creator: ecampbel
